actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.
Reported to House from the Committee on Ways and Means with amendment, H. Rept. 94-1693.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide the same tax exemptions and general tax treatment to recognized Indian tribes as are applicable to other governmental units.
short_title: Indian Tribal Governmental Tax Status Act

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on Ways and Means with amendment, H. Rept. 94-1693) Indian Tribal Governmental Tax Status Act- Affords to recognized Indian tribes the tax treatment now available to State governments. Defines the term "recognized Indian tribe" to include any tribe, band, community, village, or group of Indians or Alaska Natives recognized as performing substantial governmental functions. Permits recognized Indian tribes to issue debt obligations, the interest on which is exempt from income taxation.

titles.title: Indian Tribal Governmental Tax Status Act
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide the same tax exemptions and general tax treatment to recognized Indian tribes as are applicable to other governmental units.
